page.title: 08Buildings in Eglwysbach
page.content: There are many old buildings and farms in Eglwysbach. Some of the farms are Plas Llan, Henblas, Cefn Coed Uchaf, Pen-y-bryn, Meddiant Uchaf, Llety and Croesonnen. One of the oldest is Plas Llan which was built in 1684. The old country mansions in Eglwysbach are Pennant, Bodnant and Old Bodnod. Pennant was built in 1543. The Rev. Holland Edwards lived in Pennant and his sister married the Rev. John Bolger and then went to live there. The Pochin family lived in Bodnant, which was built about 400 years ago. Colonel Hanmer lived in Old Bodnod. St. Martin's Church was built in 1835. Some houses in Eglwysbach were built between 1847 and 1900. Many have the date of building on them. In the village we have two chapels called Ebenezer and Bethania, which was built in 1884.
